[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The NSF.gov Platform (NSF) defines requirements for managing workflows, prototypes, and user interactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: NSF supports prototyping, content management, user interviews, and visual design.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: NSF integrates with Brightcove, GitHub, and cloud hosting services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: NSF provides dashboards for employees, designers, and researchers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: NSF operates on cloud and local servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: NSF links to user recruitment tools and content management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: NSF ensures secure communication via HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: NSF optimizes storage for large prototypes and workflow data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: NSF ensures 24/7 availability with minimal downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: NSF supports customizable branding and multilingual interfaces.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: NSF links to external repositories and APIs for task management.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: NSF facilitates prototypes, interviews, content workflows, and design collaboration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: NSF serves employees, researchers, designers, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: NSF requires internet connectivity and third-party services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: NSF follows web accessibility and security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Brightcove for video management.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall link with GitHub for task tracking and issue management.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support recruitment tools for user interviews.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow content editors to manage articles and videos (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable researchers to schedule and track user interviews (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall facilitate prototype development and sharing (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall generate workflow and user engagement reports (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for managing content and interviews.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load prototypes with minimal delay.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to a few thousand concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store workflow configurations and task data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage interview schedules and participant data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with WCAG for accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt stored and transmitted data (TLS 1.3).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO information security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure nearly always uptime and secure API transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes tests for prototypes, interviews, and workflow management.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Prototypes, task workflows, and system architecture documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: WCAG, ISO standards, and GitHub documentation.
